status.name: In QA

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When a scaling group with a desired capacity of three is created and the cloud only has enough resources to launch two instances, the "Scaling history" tab fills very quickly (i.e. multiple entries per minute) and can get unwieldy (and slows the user experience), as thousands of items for the history are fetched on page load.

The Scaling history tab took over 10 seconds to load, and the UI is fairly unresponsive (e.g. expand/collapse info has a noticeable lag) when there are so many items in the history.

Screenshot attached (scaling group has over 4000 items in the scaling history tab)
fields.summary: Scaling group's Scaling history tab can become unusable when history fills up with thousands of items

comments.body:
To be clear, the history is lazy-loaded, so the page will show loading for an extended period of time (or it should).

We could use the "Max records" option on the API call to limit the number of scaling history records we show. If we max out, we can let the user know we've truncated the results for UX.
needs infinite scroll, limit to 1k items to start and then let's reevaluate performance.

EUCA-12349 was written because the API limiting doesn't work on Euca (but does on AWS). I'll limit the results in our code for now.
I also noticed AWS says the largest limit that can be set is 100, so if we want a 1000 limit, we can't use MaxRecords on the API anyway.

[~jloza]: Although PR 1937 was submitted for code review and merged, I'm pulling this out of QA for your UX review to address the following questions...

1. Could you clarify how the infinite scroll behavior should work here?  Should we display 100 records at a time, with a hard limit of 1000?  Or should we avoid the hard limit altogether?
2. If we hard-limit the results to 1000 items, should we display a notice when the scaling activities have > 1000 records?

If AWS limits to 100, there's no need for us to display more. Load about 25 at a time should be fine. Help can indicate that no more than the last 100 records are displayed. 

CC: [~tvo]

[~jloza], AWS Does not limit to 100. It's MaxRecords can be up to 100. if you don't supply that, it returns all of the records. (as the default behavior).
master currently limits to the most recent 1000 records. The latest PR adds infinite scroll showing 100, then adding 100 more till all are shown.

[~dkavanagh]: You mention "the latest PR adds infinite scroll showing 100, then adding 100 more till all are shown".  However, per PR 1937, there's a hard limit of 1000 records.  Could you and [~jloza] clarify what's the desired behavior here?  Should we remove the 1000 item hard limit, now that infinite scroll is in place?
yea, I did say that the limit of 1000 is there. and the PR adds infinite scroll. I was pretty clear.
[~kgill], I wouldn't think the user would ever need more than 1000 records. If anyone complains about that, we can always remove the limit.

Verified scaling history table is capped at 1000 rows (and loads items 100 at a time).  Used JS console as proof, since the row count isn't displayed on the scaling history page:

{code}
> $('#history-table').find('tbody').length
> 1000
{code}

Verified on: shared setup (region-one) - https://g-05-03.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Account: kamalgill/admin
Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
Tested on: IE 11 on Windows 8.1 (Version 11.0.9600.18321)
Release: 0.9457.190.git97745f1.el7
